examples: Tuatara and its lineage comes off here.
What lineage gave rise to these weird reptiles with beaks for mouths and retractable necks?
Within the hominids, the orangutan lineage branched off between 12 and 15 million years ago.
One lineage of aquatic temnospondyls proliferated in the early Triassic: the Stereospondyls.
A pedigree is proof of a dog's lineage.
words.defineEn: the group of one's relatives who share an ancestor
words.defineVi: nhóm người thân của một người có chung tổ tiên

examples: Otoliths also sense linear motion.
This is linear.
It was linear.

Their linears are also called Red.
words.defineEn: designating or involving an equation whose terms are of the first degree
words.defineVi: chỉ định hoặc liên quan đến một phương trình có các thuật ngữ ở mức độ đầu tiên

examples: Here's your liners right there on the ground.

This is the NYX Epic Ink liner in black.

But this is the Nyx matte liquid liner.
words.defineEn: a piece of cloth that is used as the inside surface of a garment
words.defineVi: một mảnh vải được sử dụng như bề mặt bên trong của quần áo

examples: In his work on binomial nomenclature, Linneaus set-up a similarity hierarchy where we move from most similar groups to least similar groups.
Linnaeus got a medical degree and became a professor at Uppsala University where he devoted himself to the study of nomenclature.
The nomenclature's getting really confusing there.
The Cherokee began life in the 1970s as a two door version of the Wagoneer built on the Wagoneer's large platform called the SJ platform in the company's nomenclature.

words.defineEn: a system of words used to name things in a particular discipline
words.defineVi: một hệ thống các từ được sử dụng để đặt tên cho những thứ trong một chuyên ngành cụ thể

examples: This all looks nominal.
"Nominal" means a price from the past that hasn't been adjusted for inflation.
So not only will we have to ensure safe operations for the passengers on board, but also for off nominal cases, ensuring the safety of the folks that are on the ground.
The main enemy was Shamil Basayev, a Chechen man who was a nominal separatist.

words.defineEn: relating to or constituting or bearing or giving a name
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc cấu thành hoặc mang hoặc đặt tên

examples: Well it was just nominated for an Oscar, so put that in your pipe and smoke it!
An obscure Nebraska congressman is nominated for president, William Jennings Bryan.
The next day, the president nominated Bork.
Five years ago, residents were nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize for saving the lives of so many migrants.
You can't nominate Merrick Garland or anybody.
words.defineEn: propose as a candidate for some honor
words.defineVi: đề xuất như một ứng cử viên cho một số danh dự

examples: And, even tonight, energy nominee also passed a key procedural vote in the Senate easily.
We were picking new nominees.
Enter Republican nominee James Garfield.
Senators heard from five crucial nominees, amid security concerns on the eve of the inauguration.
That the nominees would be more ideological.
words.defineEn: someone who has been officially suggested for a position, award, etc.
words.defineVi: một người đã được đề nghị chính thức cho một vị trí, giải thưởng, vv

examples: But of course that's a lot harder in actuality.
In actuality like, just cut them out of your life.

People can appear to be healthy and well, but in actuality, they can be the host to this deadly disease.
For some reason I thought that he had drowned when this trick went horribly wrong, but in actuality it was only a punch to the gut that did him in.
words.defineEn: the state of actually existing objectively
words.defineVi: trạng thái thực sự tồn tại một cách khách quan

words.defineEn: of or relating to the work of an actuary
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến công việc của một chuyên gia tính toán

examples: Pretty much just negating the opposition's votes.

words.defineEn: to say that something either does not exist or is not true
words.defineVi: để nói rằng một cái gì đó hoặc là không tồn tại hoặc là không đúng sự thật

examples: In many languages like Spanish, Greek and Hebrew, a second negative serves to confirm or amplify the negation known as negative concord.

Now, before we get started, I would like to point out a small disclaimer that this episode isn’t intended as an endorsement of any particular type of marriage or as a negation of the wonderful institution of love.
words.defineEn: disagreement with someone or something; refusal to do something
words.defineVi: bất đồng với ai đó hoặc cái gì đó; từ chối làm gì đó

examples: All three of these vaccines were 100% efficacious at preventing death in the trials.

words.defineEn: marked by qualities giving the power to produce an intended effect
words.defineVi: được đánh dấu bởi những phẩm chất mang lại sức mạnh để tạo ra một hiệu ứng mong muốn

examples: This efficacy number comes from phase III clinical trials.

words.defineEn: the power to bring about planned or wanted results
words.defineVi: sức mạnh để mang lại kết quả theo kế hoạch hoặc mong muốn

examples: The manufacturing plant has implemented efficiency measures to increase the yield of their production line.
The car manufacturer's latest model outperformed its competitors by a nose, offering slightly better fuel efficiency and a more comfortable ride.
The engineer is responsible for ensuring the safety and efficiency of the electrical system.
The company plans to put the new technology to work to improve its efficiency and reduce costs.
The main reason is efficiency.
words.defineEn: skillfulness in avoiding wasted time and effort
words.defineVi: khéo léo trong việc tránh lãng phí thời gian và công sức

examples: To my way of thinking, this approach is more efficient.
I don't especially like the woman but, credit where credit's due, she's very efficient.
The new software system proved to be reliable and efficient, as it remained in action without any issues during a busy week of data processing.
There was no sort of prison system to hold offenders so the most efficient way of ridding society of them was by putting them to death.
The software developer took the time to write clean and efficient code, recognizing that if a thing is worth doing, it is worth doing well and ensuring that the program was of the highest quality.
words.defineEn: (of a person) working in an organized, careful, and quick way
words.defineVi: (của một người) làm việc một cách có tổ chức, cẩn thận và nhanh chóng
